result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hayley Kierstin Richter

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:21 AM Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hayley Kierstin Richter appeared by phone.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Hayley Kierstin Richter. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hayley Kierstin Richter not in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Hayley Kierstin Richter. Preliminary Hearing requested by zoom, waiving time limits. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

04:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hayley Kierstin Richter appeared in custody by video from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Hayley Kierstin Richter. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $1000 Signature Bond with conditions: No exchanging food share benefits for anything other than food. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
No exchanging food share benefits for anything other than food.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
